newsitem.title: FRANCE: Chirac wants currency discipline in EU.
newsitem.headline: Chirac wants currency discipline in EU.

text.p: French President Jacques Chirac said on Monday he wanted all European Union countries to adhere to "currency discipline" in the months ahead, especially those who will not join a single currency at its launch in 1999.

"There are rules of the game which must absolutely be defined in the coming months which allow the imposition on countries who belong to the European Union but who do not yet fulfill the conditions to enter into the single currency system, a currency discipline without which the entire European market would be seriously perturbed," Chirac said.
Speaking to a group of corporate chiefs on a visit to the north of France, he said currency fluctuations in Europe were "unacceptable" and were a "primary source of our difficulties."

"This is another reason to proceed with determination ...toward a single currency which will allow us to avoid this sort of inconvenience and to reinforce our action...against the dollar," Chirac said. frs/cnn/bfl
